title: Track Awesome Python Scientific Audio Updates Daily

items.title: Awesome Python Scientific Audio Updates on Oct 23, 2019
items.content_text:
### Audio Related Packages

*   Total number of packages: 66

### Audio Related Packages / Transformations - General DSP

*   [SFS-Python](http://www.sfstoolbox.org) [:octocat: (‚≠ê69)](https://github.com/sfstoolbox/sfs-python) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sfs/) - Sound Field Synthesis Toolbox.

### Audio Related Packages / Speech Processing

*   [deepspeech (‚≠ê27k)](https://github.com/mozilla/DeepSpeech) [:octocat: (‚≠ê27k)](https://github.com/mozilla/DeepSpeech) [:package:](https://pypi.org/project/deepspeech/) - Pretrained automatic speech recognition.
*   [persephone](https://persephone.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê157)](https://github.com/persephone-tools/persephone) [:package:](https://pypi.org/project/persephone/) - Automatic phoneme transcription tool.
*   [pypesq (‚≠ê386)](https://github.com/vBaiCai/python-pesq) [:octocat: (‚≠ê386)](https://github.com/vBaiCai/python-pesq) - Wrapper for the PESQ score calculation.
*   [pystoi (‚≠ê344)](https://github.com/mpariente/pystoi) [:octocat: (‚≠ê344)](https://github.com/mpariente/pystoi) [:package:](https://pypi.org/project/pystoi) - Short Term Objective Intelligibility measure (STOI).
*   [SIDEKIT](http://lium.univ-lemans.fr/sidekit/) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/SIDEKIT/) - Speaker and Language recognition.

### Audio Related Packages / Environmental Sounds

*   [sed\_eval](http://tut-arg.github.io/sed_eval) [:octocat: (‚≠ê149)](https://github.com/TUT-ARG/sed_eval) [:package:](https://pypi.org/project/sed_eval/) - Evaluation toolbox for Sound Event Detection

### Audio Related Packages / Perceptial Models - Auditory Models

*   [cochlea (‚≠ê111)](https://github.com/mrkrd/cochlea) [:octocat: (‚≠ê111)](https://github.com/mrkrd/cochlea) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/cochlea/) - Inner ear models.
*   [Loudness (‚≠ê36)](https://github.com/deeuu/loudness) [:octocat: (‚≠ê36)](https://github.com/deeuu/loudness) - Perceived loudness, includes Zwicker, Moore/Glasberg model.
*   [pyloudnorm](https://www.christiansteinmetz.com/projects-blog/pyloudnorm) [:octocat: (‚≠ê712)](https://github.com/csteinmetz1/pyloudnorm) - Audio loudness meter and normalization, implements ITU-R BS.1770-4.
*   [Sound Field Synthesis Toolbox](http://www.sfstoolbox.org) [:octocat: (‚≠ê69)](https://github.com/sfstoolbox/sfs-python) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sfs/) - Sound Field Synthesis Toolbox.

items.title: Awesome Python Scientific Audio Updates on Jun 21, 2017
items.content_text:
### Audio Related Packages / Feature extraction

*   [audiolazy (‚≠ê702)](https://github.com/danilobellini/audiolazy) [:octocat: (‚≠ê702)](https://github.com/danilobellini/audiolazy) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/audiolazy/) - Realtime Audio Processing lib, general purpose.
*   [aubio](http://aubio.org/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê3.5k)](https://github.com/aubio/aubio) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/aubio) - Feature extractor, written in C, Python interface.
*   [python\_speech\_features (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/jameslyons/python_speech_features) [:octocat: (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/jameslyons/python_speech_features) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python_speech_features) - Common speech features for ASR.

### Audio Related Packages / Read-Write

*   [audioread (‚≠ê513)](https://github.com/beetbox/audioread) [:octocat: (‚≠ê513)](https://github.com/beetbox/audioread) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/audioread/) - Cross-library (GStreamer + Core Audio + MAD + FFmpeg) audio decoding.
*   [pySox (‚≠ê527)](https://github.com/rabitt/pysox) [:octocat: (‚≠ê527)](https://github.com/rabitt/pysox) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pysox/) - Wrapper for sox.
*   [tinytag (‚≠ê767)](https://github.com/devsnd/tinytag) [:octocat: (‚≠ê767)](https://github.com/devsnd/tinytag) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/tinytag/) - reading music meta data of MP3, OGG, FLAC and Wave files.

### Audio Related Packages / Transformations - General DSP

*   [AudioTK (‚≠ê252)](https://github.com/mbrucher/AudioTK) [:octocat: (‚≠ê252)](https://github.com/mbrucher/AudioTK) - DSP filter toolbox (lots of filters).
*   [Gammatone (‚≠ê221)](https://github.com/detly/gammatone) [:octocat: (‚≠ê221)](https://github.com/detly/gammatone) - Gammatone filterbank implementation.
*   [pyFFTW](http://pyfftw.github.io/pyFFTW/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê395)](https://github.com/pyFFTW/pyFFTW) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pyFFTW/) - Wrapper for FFTW(3).
*   [MDCT (‚≠ê53)](https://github.com/nils-werner/mdct) [:octocat: (‚≠ê53)](https://github.com/nils-werner/mdct) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mdct) - MDCT transform.
*   [pydub](http://pydub.com) [:octocat: (‚≠ê9.5k)](https://github.com/jiaaro/pydub) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mdct) - Manipulate audio with a simple and easy high level interface.
*   [pytftb](http://tftb.nongnu.org) [:octocat: (‚≠ê273)](https://github.com/scikit-signal/pytftb) - Implementation of the MATLAB Time-Frequency Toolbox.
*   [PyRubberband (‚≠ê197)](https://github.com/bmcfee/pyrubberband) [:octocat: (‚≠ê197)](https://github.com/bmcfee/pyrubberband) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pyrubberband/) - Wrapper for [rubberband](http://breakfastquay.com/rubberband/) to do pitch-shifting and time-stretching.
*   [Resampy](http://resampy.readthedocs.io) [:octocat: (‚≠ê271)](https://github.com/bmcfee/resampy) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/resampy) - Sample rate conversion.
*   [STFT](http://stft.readthedocs.io) [:octocat: (‚≠ê46)](https://github.com/nils-werner/stft) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/stft) - Standalone package for Short-Time Fourier Transform.

### Audio Related Packages / Speech Processing

*   [aeneas](https://www.readbeyond.it/aeneas/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/readbeyond/aeneas/) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/aeneas/) - Forced aligner, based on MFCC+DTW, 35+ languages.
*   [pyAudioAnalysis (‚≠ê6.1k)](https://github.com/tyiannak/pyAudioAnalysis)¬≤ [:octocat: (‚≠ê6.1k)](https://github.com/tyiannak/pyAudioAnalysis) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pyAudioAnalysis/) - Feature Extraction, Classification, Diarization.
*   [py-webrtcvad (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/wiseman/py-webrtcvad) [:octocat: (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/wiseman/py-webrtcvad) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/webrtcvad/) -  Interface to the WebRTC Voice Activity Detector.
*   [SpeechRecognition (‚≠ê8.8k)](https://github.com/Uberi/speech_recognition) [:octocat: (‚≠ê8.8k)](https://github.com/Uberi/speech_recognition) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/SpeechRecognition/) -  Wrapper for several ASR engines and APIs, online and offline.

### Audio Related Packages / Music Information Retrieval

*   [Catchy (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/jvbalen/catchy) [:octocat: (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/jvbalen/catchy) - Corpus Analysis Tools for Computational Hook Discovery.
*   [Madmom](https://madmom.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/CPJKU/madmom) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/madmom) - MIR packages with strong focus on beat detection, onset detection and chord recognition.
*   [mir\_eval](http://craffel.github.io/mir_eval/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê657)](https://github.com/craffel/mir_eval) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mir_eval) - Common scores for various MIR tasks. Also includes bss\_eval implementation.

### Audio Related Packages / Realtime applications

*   [PYO](http://ajaxsoundstudio.com/software/pyo/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/belangeo/pyo) - Realtime audio dsp engine.
*   [python-sounddevice (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/spatialaudio/python-sounddevice) [:octocat:](http://python-sounddevice.readthedocs.io) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sounddevice) - PortAudio wrapper providing realtime audio I/O with NumPy.

### Audio Related Packages / Audio Dataset and Dataloaders

*   [beets](http://beets.io/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/beetbox/beets) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/beets) - Music library manager and [MusicBrainz](https://musicbrainz.org/) tagger.
*   [medleydb](http://medleydb.readthedocs.io) [:octocat: (‚≠ê199)](https://github.com/marl/medleydb) - Parse [medleydb](http://medleydb.weebly.com/) audio + annotations.
*   [Soundcloud API (‚≠ê106)](https://github.com/soundcloud/soundcloud-python) [:octocat: (‚≠ê106)](https://github.com/soundcloud/soundcloud-python) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/soundcloud) - Wrapper for [Soundcloud API](https://developers.soundcloud.com/).

### Audio Related Packages / Wrappers for Audio Plugins

*   [VamPy Host](https://code.soundsoftware.ac.uk/projects/vampy-host) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/vamp) - Interface compiled vamp plugins.

### Tutorials / Wrappers for Audio Plugins

*   [MIR Notebooks](http://musicinformationretrieval.com/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/stevetjoa/stanford-mir) - collection of instructional iPython Notebooks for music information retrieval (MIR).
*   [Selected Topics in Audio Signal Processing (‚≠ê69)](https://github.com/spatialaudio/selected-topics-in-audio-signal-processing-exercises) - Exercises as iPython notebooks.

### Books / Wrappers for Audio Plugins

*   [Python Data Science Handbook (‚≠ê45k)](https://github.com/jakevdp/PythonDataScienceHandbook) - Jake Vanderplas, Excellent Book and accompanying tutorial notebooks.
*   [Fundamentals of Music Processing](https://www.audiolabs-erlangen.de/fau/professor/mueller/bookFMP) - Meinard M√ºller, comes with Python exercises.

### Scientific Papers / Wrappers for Audio Plugins

*   [Python for audio signal processing](http://eprints.maynoothuniversity.ie/4115/1/40.pdf) - John C. Glover, Victor Lazzarini and Joseph Timoney, Linux Audio Conference 2011.
*   [librosa: Audio and Music Signal Analysis in Python](http://conference.scipy.org/proceedings/scipy2015/pdfs/brian_mcfee.pdf), [Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MhOdbtPhbLU) - Brian McFee, Colin Raffel, Dawen Liang, Daniel P.W. Ellis, Matt McVicar, Eric Battenberg, Oriol Nieto, Scipy 2015.

### Other Resources / Wrappers for Audio Plugins

*   [Coursera Course](https://www.coursera.org/learn/audio-signal-processing) -  Audio Signal Processing, Python based course from UPF of Barcelona and Stanford University.
*   [Digital Signal Processing Course](http://dsp-nbsphinx.readthedocs.io/en/nbsphinx-experiment/index.html) - Masters Course Material (University of Rostock) with many Python examples.
*   [Slack Channel](https://mircommunity.slack.com) - Music Information Retrieval Community.
items.content_html:
Audio Related Packages / Feature extraction

  • audiolazy (‚≠ê702) üêô (‚≠ê702) üì¶ - Realtime Audio Processing lib, general purpose.
  • aubio üêô (‚≠ê3.5k) üì¶ - Feature extractor, written in C, Python interface.
  • python_speech_features (‚≠ê2.4k) üêô (‚≠ê2.4k) üì¶ - Common speech features for ASR.

  • pySox (‚≠ê527) üêô (‚≠ê527) üì¶ - Wrapper for sox.

  • pytftb üêô (‚≠ê273) - Implementation of the MATLAB Time-Frequency Toolbox.
  • PyRubberband (‚≠ê197) üêô (‚≠ê197) üì¶ - Wrapper for rubberband to do pitch-shifting and time-stretching.
  • Resampy üêô (‚≠ê271) üì¶ - Sample rate conversion.
  • STFT üêô (‚≠ê46) üì¶ - Standalone package for Short-Time Fourier Transform.

Audio Related Packages / Speech Processing

  • aeneas üêô (‚≠ê2.7k) üì¶ - Forced aligner, based on MFCC+DTW, 35+ languages.
  • pyAudioAnalysis (‚≠ê6.1k)¬≤ üêô (‚≠ê6.1k) üì¶ - Feature Extraction, Classification, Diarization.

Audio Related Packages / Music Information Retrieval

  • Catchy (‚≠ê21) üêô (‚≠ê21) - Corpus Analysis Tools for Computational Hook Discovery.
  • Madmom üêô (‚≠ê1.5k) üì¶ - MIR packages with strong focus on beat detection, onset detection and chord recognition.
  • mir_eval üêô (‚≠ê657) üì¶ - Common scores for various MIR tasks. Also includes bss_eval implementation.

Audio Related Packages / Realtime applications

  • PYO üêô (‚≠ê1.4k) - Realtime audio dsp engine.
  • python-sounddevice (‚≠ê1.1k) üêô üì¶ - PortAudio wrapper providing realtime audio I/O with NumPy.

Audio Related Packages / Audio Dataset and Dataloaders

  • beets üêô (‚≠ê14k) üì¶ - Music library manager and MusicBrainz tagger.
  • medleydb üêô (‚≠ê199) - Parse medleydb audio + annotations.
  • Soundcloud API (‚≠ê106) üêô (‚≠ê106) üì¶ - Wrapper for Soundcloud API.

Audio Related Packages / Wrappers for Audio Plugins

  • VamPy Host üì¶ - Interface compiled vamp plugins.

Tutorials / Wrappers for Audio Plugins

  • MIR Notebooks üêô (‚≠ê1.2k) - collection of instructional iPython Notebooks for music information retrieval (MIR).
  • Selected Topics in Audio Signal Processing (‚≠ê69) - Exercises as iPython notebooks.

Books / Wrappers for Audio Plugins

  • Python Data Science Handbook (‚≠ê45k) - Jake Vanderplas, Excellent Book and accompanying tutorial notebooks.
  • Fundamentals of Music Processing - Meinard M√ºller, comes with Python exercises.

Scientific Papers / Wrappers for Audio Plugins

  • librosa: Audio and Music Signal Analysis in Python, Video - Brian McFee, Colin Raffel, Dawen Liang, Daniel P.W. Ellis, Matt McVicar, Eric Battenberg, Oriol Nieto, Scipy 2015.

items.title: Awesome Python Scientific Audio Updates on May 08, 2017
items.content_text:
### Audio Related Packages / Symbolic Music - MIDI - Musicology

*   [Music21](http://web.mit.edu/music21/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/cuthbertLab/music21) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/music21) - Toolkit for Computer-Aided Musicology.
*   [Mido](https://mido.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/olemb/mido) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mido) - Realtime MIDI wrapper.
*   [Pretty-MIDI](http://craffel.github.io/pretty-midi/) [:octocat: (‚≠ê956)](https://github.com/craffel/pretty-midi) [:package:](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pretty-midi) - Utility functions for handling MIDI data in a nice/intuitive way.
items.content_html:

  • Music21 üêô (‚≠ê2.3k) üì¶ - Toolkit for Computer-Aided Musicology.

  • Pretty-MIDI üêô (‚≠ê956) üì¶ - Utility functions for handling MIDI data in a nice/intuitive way.
